originalText.text: Moleskin ring way to get keys and key fobs at a reasonable price. The convenience of being able to use the machine pay with your credit card and walk right out with a case. You need an essay without looking for a locksmith. I’ve already recommended these to my neighbors because the landlord charge you so much money to replace keys.

originalText.text:
I was locked out of my apartment when my daughter found this company online in an effort to help me solve the problem. At first I was very skeptical as a native New Yorker with a lot of experience with locksmiths. Andrew was my locksmith and he contacted me quickly, staying in touch with me the entire time until I made it back to my apartment from a Dr's appointment.

He literally popped the door open in 1.2 seconds. I couldn't believe it. The charge for this service was $125 or $150 but it was reduced to $90 since I was also hiring him (Key Me) to install a key code lock. The lock is beautiful and I am very happy with it. I surely will not get locked out again because now I don't need a key! I've wanted this set up for a long time.

He completed this job within an hour.

My only issue is, I feel the job was overly expensive. I paid $560 for the lock and service. Andrew was very courteous and professional. He went above and beyond to explain how to use the new lock & create codes.

Con: If I could suggest one thing it would be for the locksmith to clean up behind themselves. He left a mess at my doorway (on the wood floors) with dust, debris, and parts from installing the lock. It only takes a second to ask for a broom - even if the customer says "no, it's okay I'll do it." It's the thought or acknowledgment of the mess that counts. I really didn't like that part. Still, I tipped him $20 for the effort. I recommend this company and Andrew. Thanks Andrew. Try to clean up behind yourself when working in people's homes in the future :-)

originalText.text: They had to drill the lock to get in and scraped the door. The first gentleman had to call another man to install a new deadbolt. The second gentleman ripped a hole in my wall to get it in. No repairs, left a mess and charged me $430. I called to speak with management about the unprofessional job and now three weeks later I am still waiting for their call back even though I call daily.

originalText.text: I lost my car keys and needed a new key. I was instantly put in touch with a technician who was not the most professional however, I’m traveling from out of town and need my key. I told the man I was talking a quick shower and getting dressed but it was impossible for me to make it within an hour. I called the technician to inform him that I needed to schedule for a later time. He rudely told me to call him when I needed service. The time I was rescheduling for was between 3:30 and 4pm. I called the tech at 3:40 and he rudely told me that he didn’t have the key fob to my car all of a sudden and that i told him it was gonna be quick and I took to long. He completely disregarded that I called him to tell him that I needed more time and he told me to call him back. The dispatcher was super nice but I will never use this service again and I will make sure anyone else I know doesn’t either. I have to drive 10 hours and the technician was an absolute disgusting individual
